body:
Hi everyone.

Recently my power supply broke and I made the mistake of choosing a generic power supply. It lasted me about 2 months. It broke right before the unofficial tourney, so if you do see me on I will be on my super slow 2.13GHZ laptop.

Anyways, I'm an Asian and I like to be cheap. If you can help point me to a quality power supply that would be great. Nothing higher than $40 please and it can only be from Amazon or Ebay. Thank you.

This is what I found:
http://m.ebay.com/itm/Corsair-CX430-V2-Series-CP-9020046-US-430W-Power-Supply-80-Plus-Bronze-NEW-/29...

title: Power Supply Recommendations?

replies.body: Matters with your parts. I recommend putting all your parts on a pcpartpicker list and it will estimate the wattage you need. Then, just double that, and you can go find something around that wattage. But expect to pay about 60$, but I wouldn't know, I don't buy things from the Internet, I have a Canada Computers 10 mins away from me XD
replies.body_tagged: Matters with your parts. I recommend putting all your parts on a pcpartpicker list and it will estimate the wattage you need. Then, just double that, and you can go find something around that wattage. But expect to pay about 60$, but I wouldn't know, I don't buy things from the Internet, I have a Canada Computers 10 mins away from me XD

replies.body:
Wouldn't cheap out on the power supply if I were you. Worst mistake in PC building apart from not slotting in the I/O shield. 

Use this http://outervision.com/power-supply-calculator
Calculate how much you need and one-up it by 100w. AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, NEVER BUY ANYTHING WITHOUT AT LEAST AN 80+ rating. Would recommend 80+ gold if you can, for the sake of the longevity of your PC.

replies.body: My system is about 180W so I would say anything with 300W or higher.
replies.body_tagged: My system is about 180W so I would say anything with 300W or higher.

replies.body:
That powersupply is fine. Anything by corsair is fine.
Corsair senpai.
